entries.title: Democrats want expanded Obamacare subsidies restored in any deal to keep the federal government funded past Sept. 30
Spencer Cox, Utah’s Republican governor, addressed young people after Charlie Kirk’s killing, saying that rage might feel like the only option, but “we can choose a different path”
Charlie Kirk and JD Vance spoke regularly, talked about their families and ribbed each other. Kirk spoke to the WSJ in April about their friendship.
Following the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, the Utah Valley University community is reckoning with grief, fear and unanswered questions
President Trump’s team began putting in place tighter security measures as shock and anger reverberated through the White House following the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk
Senate Republicans invoked the so-called nuclear option to fast-track confirmation of the Trump administration’s subcabinet nominees, after negotiations with Democrats broke down
House Speaker Mike Johnson and other congressional leaders implored colleagues to lower the political temperature following the killing of Charlie Kirk, but tensions remained high on Capitol Hill
Senate Republicans voted down a measure to release more material related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, staying mostly united in blocking an effort led by Minority Leader Chuck Schumer
Three former FBI leaders accuse Kash Patel of carrying out a political purge, in a lawsuit that alleges they were illegally terminated
Reporters Liz Essley Whyte and Jesse Newman answered subscriber questions about everything from school lunches to pharmaceutical advertising
California lawmakers passed a bill to require private-equity firms to give the state advance notice before they take over any medical provider
Former Vice President Kamala Harris said in a new memoir that it was reckless to let Joe Biden and his wife decide on their own whether he should run for re-election
Democratic Party moderates see Virginia governor hopeful Abigail Spanberger as a more politically viable standard-bearer than the likes of New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani
Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz campaigned on the national ticket for just 91 days last year, but the unsuccessful vice presidential run left him politically vulnerable back home
Republican Sen. Joni Ernst isn’t expected to seek a third-term, after tussling with parts of President Trump’s MAGA base and stumbling in her efforts to defend Medicaid cuts
The GOP’s redistricting push in Texas hinges on newly-red Hispanic voters continuing to vote Republican. But there are signs that their support for the Trump agenda has faded.
A U.S. military aircraft struck a boat suspected of smuggling drugs in the Caribbean several times from the air last week, even though the vessel had turned around before the strike began
Nearly half a day after NATO ordered jet fighters to shoot down Russian drones over Polish territory, President Trump issued his first public comment, but it was a seemingly ambiguous reaction
Alleged Chinese cyber-espionage campaigns were timed to potentially deploy spyware against organizations giving input on President Trump’s trade negotiations
President Trump signed an executive order to rebrand the Department of Defense as the Department of War, reviving a name that was last used in 1947
President Trump was within his authority when he ordered the U.S. military to destroy a vessel in the Caribbean, administration officials say. But legal experts and some lawmakers dispute that claim
